Text: Sorry it took me so long, Heiress...

The girl in the garden turns around. The eyes of the
dark knight heiress are sparkling with moonlight...
and anticipation.
Yes, it certainly did take you a long time.
So what did you find? Did the investigation go well?
What a foolish question. This is child's play to me.

So what was he like? Was he a feeble man who reeked
of other women?
Now, now, hold your horses. Just listen to my report.

Zeta shrugs her shoulders at the heiress, who is
clearly quite eager.

Feebleness aside, he was quite slender. He didn't
seem to have much muscle.

There wasn't a single sword or weapon in his room.
There were books about swordplay and magic, but
it seemed he was reading them to gain knowledge
rather than for leisure.

Doesn't seem like a match for me. Our interests seem
worlds apart.
Swords and books?
I dislike reading.

And he surely dislikes the sword. He prefers sitting
still at home and reading rather than going outside
and moving his body.
Yes, that may be true...

But at the very least, he doesn't seem to dislike
going outside in and of itself—he went outside
just this morning with the village children to
pick raspberries.
Huh?

It seems like that's the sort of thing he does every
day. The village children, the merchants at his
door, and the servants all sung his praises.

He never boasts or brags, he never takes advantage
of his family's power, and he didn't seem to have an
insidious or arrogant personality.
W-Wait a minute—
Hush. I'm not finished giving my report.

The heiress tries to interrupt Zeta—the report is
not what she had expected. But Zeta frowns and
silences her.

His mother is sickly. He was taking very good care of
her, in part, because he is going to move out soon.

From what I could see of the books on his bookshelf
and desk, he's been studying medicine lately. I'd
wager he's trying to find a cure for his mother's
ailment.

But...this is all news to me. I had no idea his
mother was ill...

Why would you have known about it? It's not the sort
of thing people write on their family charts when
they enter an arranged marriage.

Oh, that's right. He also had books on magic. They
looked rather complicated, but he took lots of notes.

He wasn't a pleasure-seeker—he was a knowledge-
seeker. And a diligent one at that.
I have to ask... Were there any signs of a girlfriend?

Of course not. I searched his room and found zilch.
Not even so much as an old love letter.

Your groom-to-be is just an ordinary gentleman.
Though you scoffed at your father earlier,
wondering what he was thinking...
I think he has pretty good judgement, personally.
The heiress falls silent, a sour look on her face.
Well, it's up to you whether you believe me or not.

I thought he was a feeble man who was unworthy of my
house...but perhaps I was the only one who felt this way.

He is a man of character, beloved by everyone in his
village... It would seem it takes more than good
swordsmanship to determine the worth of a man.
Okaaay...

The heiress drops her gaze in thought...but Zeta
seems rather uninterested.

Zeta loses interest easily. And with her intel report
finished, any former interest she had in the mission
that had taken all day is completely gone.

And on that note, I think we can call the job done.
I'll take my payment now.

Why yes, of course... You wanted a sword or some
other weapon, correct?
Yeah, about that, can I see your library first?
My library? Do you suddenly want a book now?
Can't I?

Oh, yes, of course you can. But are you sure that's
what you want?
Yeah, I'm sure.

As nice as your mansion is, I imagine there's at
least one or two rare books in your library. Like,
about magic and stuff.

I'm not sure about magic books, but if it's old books
you want, our library is full of them.
Ah hah, so I was right.
Zeta narrows her eyes and grins.

The only settlements around the old ruins are the
tiny town Zeta is in, and the large village where
the heiress's groom comes from.

(There wasn't any intelligence or important items by
the ruins.)

(And even if such things did exist, it's more likely
the elites who live nearby would be keeping them
in their personal collections.)

(I need to recover any such books before the bookish
husband moves in...)

From all the conversations they'd had thus far, it
is obvious to Zeta that the heiress has limited
knowledge on the value of books.

(Now's my window. I can take any valuable books I
like with me.)

(Depending on what I find, Eta might be interested.
And I should be able to break even on my lack of
intel about the Cult.)

If I see any good books in the library, I'm taking
a stack of 'em.
As you wish.
Yes, yes, a successful negotiation!
Okay, show me that library.

Zeta turns her back on the heiress and starts to
walk towards the mansion.
Hmmm?

Noticing the heiress isn't following her, she turns
around after a few paces.
What's wrong? Ah hah, I think I know...

After all this time...are you scared of a spy coming
into your house?

Of course not... Besides, a skilled spy like you
could enter my house even without an invitation.
It's just...black cats...
Yeah?

Black cats are supposed to bring bad luck...but now
I'm starting to think that's not true.

It's my clothes that make me black. And white cats
bring you good luck.

(Well, it really depends on who crosses paths with
a white cat...)

And with the moonlight shining on her, the cat lifts
half of her mouth in a lopsided smirk.
